title: Showing quota of webdav remotes(e.g. nextcloud)
body:
<!--

Welcome :-)

So you've got an idea to improve rclone? We love that! You'll be glad to hear we've incorporated hundreds of ideas from contributors already.

Here is a checklist of things to do:

  1. Please search the old issues first for your idea and +1 or comment on an existing issue if possible.
  2. Discuss on the forum first: https://forum.rclone.org/
  3. Make a feature request issue (this is the right place!).
  4. Be prepared to get involved making the feature :-)

Looking forward to your great idea!

The Rclone Developers

-->


#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

rclone v1.45-108-g184a9c8d-beta

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

Showing the real used&free space of webdav mount.

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

[Rfc4331](http://www.webdav.org/specs/rfc4331.html) allowed clients to query quota infomations of the webdav server.
Both Nextcloud and Owncloud supports it.
Tested with curl:
```bash
curl -u admin:admin 'https://NEXTCLOUD_URL/remote.php/webdav/' -X PROPFIND --data '<?xml version="1.0" ?><D:propfind xmlns:D="DAV:"><D:prop>           <D:quota-available-bytes/><D:quota-used-bytes/></D:prop></D:propfind>' -H "Depth: 0"
```
Additional header:
```
Depth: 0
```
Post data:
```xml
      <?xml version="1.0" ?>
      <D:propfind xmlns:D="DAV:">
        <D:prop>
          <D:quota-available-bytes/>
          <D:quota-used-bytes/>
        </D:prop>
      </D:propfind>
```
Response:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0"?> 
<d:multistatus xmlns:d="DAV:" xmlns:s="http://sabredav.org/ns" xmlns:oc="http://owncloud.org/ns" xmlns:nc="http://nextcloud.org/ns">
    <d:response>
        <d:href>/remote.php/webdav/</d:href>
        <d:propstat>
               <d:prop>
                    <d:quota-available-bytes>93889607</d:quota-available-bytes>
                    <d:quota-used-bytes>10967993</d:quota-used-bytes>
                </d:prop>
               <d:status>HTTP/1.1 2 00 OK</d:status>
        </d:propstat>
    </d:response>
</d:multistatus>
```
